intro: Cylindrolobus kenejianus, commonly known as the Kenejian's cylinder lobed plant, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions in the Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its unique cylindrical and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
